fields.description: I have a habit to right click on the dock icon when I need to open a repo I haven't opened yet, but sometimes I need to get to a repo that I haven't used recently and a Repository Browser option right there would feel extremely convenient.
fields.summary: Dock menu "Show Repository Browser" option

fields.description:
Every day need to re-login on preferences > accounts to can push if not take error 403

Also in the oauth I need login 2 times, on different login pages. See the attached images.

When I change the project I need to relogin too
fields.summary: The requested URL returned error: 403 on push

fields.description:
I will get the following error regularly, once I start having the error, I eventually get the "too many attempt" error and I have to log back on from the website. Last time I changed my password to be able to push successfully. This error happens even though I was able to push another change 5 minutes before on another branch.



Pushing to https://xxx@bitbucket.org/xxx/xxx.git

WARNING: Authentication error: Authentication required: Authorization error: https://xxx@bitbucket.org/xxx/xxx.git/info/lfs/locks/verify

Check that you have proper access to the repository

batch response: Authorization error: https://xxx@bitbucket.org/xxx/xxx.git/info/lfs/objects/batch

Check that you have proper access to the repository

error: failed to push some refs to 'https://xxx@bitbucket.org/xxx/xxx.git'
fields.summary: Source tree will regularly stop allowing me to push/pull with an authentication error

fields.description:
When I pull a commit that has a submodule change, my submodules don't seem to be updated.  Sourcetree then shows a change under File status for the submodule.  It would be nice to have a button that does the equivalent of "git submodule update --recursive", or just make a pull do this automatically.

Right now the solution my company is using is to create a custom action re https://stackoverflow.com/questions/12899163/where-is-git-submodule-update-in-sourcetree
fields.summary: Add a way to update submodules

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce issue
 * Create a new branch locally with a *comma(,)* in its name (e.g. *testing-new,branch*)
 * Push the changes to BitBucket
 * Check out another branch
 * Switching back to the branch with *testing-new,branch* would produce the following error
 ** error: pathspec *'testing-new'* did not match any file(s) known to git
 *** Note that the branch name mentioned in the error excludes the comma and anything that follows
fields.summary: Unable to switch to a branch with comma(,) in the name

fields.description: When some Modified Binary File is selected on page "File status" the section "Staged files" starts to shrink and never gets back to normal
fields.summary: Screen does not resize properly on "File status"

fields.description:
The Push / Pull / Fetch icons on the menu bar are in a different order on PC and Mac.

On PC: Push - Pull - Fetch

On Mac: Pull - Push - Fetch

This is just a little bit annoying as I'm used to the Windows interface and now occasionally code on Mac. I'm therefore occasionally pressing the wrong button! Is there a reason for them being in a different order? This just seems unnecessarily confusing?
fields.summary: Menu Bar icons in different order on PC and Mac

fields.description: Git branch remains after using Git Flow 'finish feature' and choosing to 'Delete Branch' after finishing.
fields.summary: Branch is not deleted after using Git Flow 'finish feature'
Support for -u feature of git stash

fields.description:
When I try to clone any remote repository in Sourcetree, I'm not able to say how I would like to have that remote repository named as I can do with git CLI:

{{git clone -o <my_remote_name> <remote_URL>}}

Could you please add field to clone repository form where user can specify remote name?

Thank you.
fields.summary: Naming remote during clone of remote repository

In the attached video when I select `File Status` at the end - nothing happens.

*Update:*

Also happens when selecting different branches (doesn't matter local or remote)

fields.description:
Our entire team upgraded to 2.7.1. We all now experience crashes 3-4 times a day (the app just unexpectedly crashes). Half the team has downgraded to 2.6 while rest of us are wondering why we switched from using Git Tower (especially after experiencing how your developers handle support request).

Any hope for us? Should we just not update any more?
fields.summary: App crashes frequnetly since updating to 2.7.1

fields.description:
When Source Tree’s theme is set to dark, there is this ugly white background filling up the screen, when there is nothing to commit, cf. attachment.

It’s just a suggestion, but I wonder whether the team can discuss a more pleasant solution to something “darker”.
fields.summary: Unpleasant white background in dark mode when nothing to commit
sometimes I click settings in one project then got 'infinite loop loading'

fields.description:
When you switch branch in a repo, the row for that repo in the "SourceTree" overview of all repos does not update its branch name. So you can become confused about which branch you are working with.

See attached image.
fields.summary: Branch name does not update after branch switch
sourceTree korean text is broken right beside of image icon

fields.description: When multiple repos are open, it's hard to figure out which SourceTree window I want to open because visually they look the same in osx Mission Control. Would be nice to allow them to be skinned or somehow made visually different.
fields.summary: Allow a different theme per repo
profile photo is not visible

fields.description:
Source Tree inherited tab support and full screen support via updates to macOS. However, these features are somewhat limited. To enhance support it, would be really helpful to have the option to specify that when opening a new git repo it opens in a new tab rather than a separate window. Also when in full screen if I do a cmd+0 to bring up the repo browser, it would be nice if it supported a split screen popup, rather than opening a separate full screen window. To see an example of what I mean, open the native MacOS mail client in full screen mode. Then click compose new message button in the top right. It will enter split screen mode.

it is worth noting that if you manually setup split screen mode with the repo browser on the right and the main window on the left, when opening a new window from the repo browser, mac OS already directly opens it as a new tab.
fields.summary: macOS improve tabs and full screen support.

fields.description:
This bug occurs very very very frequently.
Even happens when doing another program while running this program.
This bus has been happening since applying the latest update patch.
I send an error log file attachment.
fields.summary: bug issue

fields.description: In Sourcetree if you have submodules you need to open the submodules to see which branch they are on... can we have a feature where next to the name of the submodule it tells your the branch name (e.g. `{color:#14892c}my-submodule (HEAD){color}` or `{color:#14892c}my-submodule (develop){color}`)
fields.summary: Show branch name of submodules

fields.description:
Hi, I'm sourcetree user from South Korea.

I made branch that using korean branch name, (180313_한국어_테스트)
After checking out that branch it'not still bold. 

My co-worker using same version of sourcetree doesn't have same problem. 

Thank you in advance,
fields.summary: korean branch name is not bold after checkout

fields.description:
When a release has slash symbol in the name

!image-2018-03-12-18-13-16-803.png!

!image-2018-03-12-18-14-57-045.png!

and it isn't possible to finish a release by choosing other action because the drop down is empty

!image-2018-03-12-18-16-32-631.png!
fields.summary: When a release has a slash it isn't possible to finish release with GUI

fields.description:
It happens very often that in the left pane something is still selected (e.g. a branch, or a stash), but the right pane is out-of-sync after some git action. In the case of a branch it does not help to click it again in the left pane, as SourceTree ignores clicks on elements that are already selected. In that case I have to click a different branch and then click the initial branch again in order to get to the right view in the right pane.
Related, often the right pane does not update when e.g. selecting a stash in the left pane. The right pane just stays empty. Only when I select another stash, the diff is shown correctly in the right pane.
fields.summary: Right Pane does not Update

fields.description:
Even OAuth configured with Google account. Sourcetree still prompts Password login. But still can't login with correct password:
 * Cannot push code in Sourcetree with correct username and password.
 * Cannot pull subtree in Sourcetree with correct username and password.
fields.summary: Can't authenticate with username and password

fields.description:
SourceTree 2.7.1 uses Git-Flow AVH 1.11.0 now, which by default not only deletes the local release branch on finish, but also the remote branch. One can suppress this behavior with the command line option _--keepremote_. Unfortunately SourceTree does not offer an equivalent option in its GUI, so that the remote branch is always deleted. This becomes a problem when using SourceTree in conjunction with a Jenkins multi branch pipeline. The latter one automatically creates and deletes a Jenkins job per branch as git branches appear or disappear. This means, when finishing a git-flow release using SourceTree, then the related Jenkins release job automatically gets deleted including the created artifacts, build logs and test reports. This destroyed our last software release, since the changed git-flow behavior was unexpected.

SourceTree should at least provide an option, which is equivalent to the git-flow-ahv command line parameter _--keepremote_.
fields.summary: cannot disable automatic deletion of remote branch on git-flow finish release

fields.description:
When I launch Sourcetree, its UI immediately shows:
Authentication Completed with an Error
An error occurred while authenticating your account ...  You can view the server's response below.
Error Contents
message: Requires authentication
https://developer.github.com/v3/users/#get-the-authenticated-user
Sign In
 
When I click the Sign In button, a new dialog appears:
Please sign in to this account:
Sign in to Github to continue to Sourcetree for Mac
Username or email address
Password
Sign In

If I enter my username or password incorrectly and click Sign In, it gets rejected with "Incorrect username or password" (testing that logging in with the correct username and password will actually work).

When I enter my username and password correctly and click Sign In, it gets accepted, the dialog disappears, and then the original screen starting with "Authentication Completed with an Error" reappears (see top of this report).

This much may have already been reported, but I couldn't find any mention in the open bug list of the next feature - the program can't be closed.  The red "X" in the upper left corner of the Sourcetree UI is gone, and if I click "Sourcetree", "Quit Sourcetree" in the top menu, it beeps at me and the program continues running.  Same result if I attempt to quit it from the dock menu.  The only way to close it is Force Quit with Cmd+Opt+Esc or force a restart of the Mac.

Finally, if I open a terminal and do a pull from Github, it works fine.
fields.summary: Infinite loop around Authentication Error

fields.description:
I don't know what to tell you about how this happened. It is definitely concerning for any files that change without being noticed.

I pulled down the latest change from what is our project's master branch which I will just call master(Sourcetree). I then created a branch off of our master branch (Bit Bucket). I think checked out the new branch in Sourcetree(BitBucket->Sourcetree). I modified my files and thought one of them looked off but I didn't know enough about it to make any changes to it and pushed the changes to origin(Sourcetree->Bitbucket). Next I opened a pull request and got it approved as all the changes were what was needed(Bit Bucket). I then conferred with my coworkers about the file that was off. There were a bunch of changes shouldn't be there as they were backed out months ago. Looking into the history of the file the commit before mine had all the changes backed out. There was a significant mismatch between the two versions. The problem is that the diff only recognized the changes that I had implemented. and ignored everything else that changed. It even showed in blame that the changes of those lines went back to their original commit instead of the one that fixed it.
fields.summary: Local repository copy doesn't match server after pull

fields.description: Merging of feature via git-flow doesn't work.
fields.summary: git-flow doesn't work on macOS

fields.description:
SourceTree has a very CPU utilisation constantly when running in the background. This is between 50-80% and is the most power consuming app. More than Chrome.

I see a "flicker" on the dots (build status) in the commit list. It could like they are being reloaded / re-drawn all the time. Maybe the whole view is being repainted constantly. Maybe that is a hint.

I also see a lot of entries in the log file:

error 15:22:26.435287 +0100 Sourcetree TIC Read Status [34178:0x0]: 1:57error 15:22:26.435287 +0100 Sourcetree TIC Read Status [34178:0x0]: 1:57
fields.summary: SourceTree has a high CPU utilization
German localization causes truncated or misaligned UI elements.

fields.description:
h2. Problem:
The Show Repository Browser | Remote page queries Bitbucket Server for a list of repositories that the user has permission to.  However in a large enterprise, with thousands of projects and thousands of users, you can overwhelm even a multi-node Data Center instance with the number of REST API requests that are made.

h2. Steps to Duplicate
# Configure SourceTree to connect to a remote Bitbucket Server or Data Center instance that has a significant number of projects.
# On the Bitbucket Server tail the atlassian-bitbucket.log
# Enable Debug Logging in Bitbucket server
# In SourceTree visit the Show Repository Browser page and then click Remote

h3. Result:
You will see at least one and maybe two mentions of the REST API pre project that is being called
{noformat}
/rest/api/1.0/projects/{PROJKEY}/repos
{noformat}

For a small or even medium sized instance this may not be noticed.  However is a large enterprise with up to 10,000 users and thousands of projects, when more than a few users are accessing the Repository Browser simultaneously the  number of REST API requests that are happening simultaneously can negatively impact the performance of Bitbucket Server.

When you further complicate this with using Delegated LDAP for authentication, each of these REST API calls causes a validation to LDAP.  This can also cause thousands of SQL Update commands to be fired off updating the cwd_user table row for the user that is connecting to Bitbucket.

h2. Desired Behavior
A list of possible options not necessarily in any particular order:
- Use a different REST API that returns all the users repositories they have access to with one call
- Have the Repository Browser be paged so that only 10 or 15 projects are queried at a time
- Change the UI so that you get a list of projects first (1 REST API call), and the display is updated with the repositories in the selected project (1 REST API call for every 25 repositories in the project)
- Make browsing the available repositories optional, provide the ability to paste a clone URL without having to query every project
fields.summary: Visiting the Show Repository Browser, then Remote can generate hundreds of REST API calls to Bitbucket Server

fields.description:
My repo settings have already been configured, it just makes me re-configure it every time I restart source tree.

I go into edit the settings make no changes hit ok then everything works.

Please add tests for this into your CI/CD pipeline.
fields.summary: SourceTree constantly asking to set up repo for pull requests

fields.description:
One of our Mac users uses SourceTree to connect to our Bitbucket Server instance. The connection is configured to use SSH. After recently changing they're network password, attempts to browse/refresh remote repos now generate the following error:
{quote}
*Login Error*
Login failed for your Bitbucket Server account.
The remote service said: 'The operation couldn't be completed. (SDNetDomain error 7.)'
{quote}

This sounds similar to SRCTREE-4021, though it wasn't clear if that issue was for a connection to Bitbucket Server or Cloud. We've tried the suggested workarounds (removing/re-adding the account, removing the Application Support folder) but the issue persists.

We're confused as to why it's even prompting for a password when the account/connection is configured to use SSH.

For now, the workaround is to browse the remote repos using the Bitbucket UI via a browser.
fields.summary: Login error on remote repo refresh

fields.description:
After "finishing" a Release branch with the Git Flow button, the branch is deleted and Sourcetree selects master branch as the newly active branch.

I then immediately switch to the develop branch... except when I forget and accidentally commit my next batch of code to the wrong branch.

It would be better if Sourcetree selected the "develop" branch after finishing a feature, since that's the primary branch for the repository.
fields.summary: Git Flow switch to develop after releasing

fields.description:
Case:

I merge one branch into other and I wanna commit without several files.

If there is more then 20 files it a little bit annoying find right files.

I know filenames and file part.

It would be great to have a field to fast search in the top (after title `Unstaged files` and 'Staged files') - it can work as a filter or as sorting as well.
fields.summary: Search over unstaged/staged files

fields.description:
When trying to merge, using the right click menu -> Merge...

I except to see the merge dialog, so I can do the merge.

But actually no merge dialog appears.

As seen below the "Commit Merge Immediately (if no conflicts)" stretches to fill instead of the commit file changes preview box.

!https://i.imgur.com/VX74ghg.png!

fields.description:
In the repository browser window a double-click on an item does not open the window for that repo. I have to right-click on the item and select Open, or it will also open if I select the item and press Enter.

In addition, I seem to be unable to draw items into folders, or to reorder them.
fields.summary: Repository Browser UI Issues

fields.description:
Right now there's an option to either "show remote branches" or "hide remote branches"

I'm working on a large repo with a lot of contributors and branches. I'm not interested in most of them, but I'd still like to see remote branches I'm tracking (master...)

Would it be possible to add a third option "show tracked remote branches" ?
fields.summary: Option to show tracked remote branches

fields.description: After upgrading to 2.7.1 GIT Flow Finish Feature no longer deletes the local branch. It has to be done manually.
fields.summary: GIT Flow Finish Feature doesn't delete local branch

fields.description:
Preferences > Git > "Perform submodule actions recursively" is checked

Repository > Repository Settings > Advanced > "Disable recursive operations on submodules" is NOT checked

Given I have both pullable commits on main repository AND on submodule, When I pull commits on the main repository, Then I expect the submodule recursively performs a pull operation, but actually no pull is performed on the submodule
fields.summary: "Perform submodule actions recursively" does nothing

fields.description:
After upgrading to 2.7.1, when performing an git svn rebase the following error occurs:

 

 
{noformat}
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false -c credential.helper=sourcetree svn rebase
"get_record" is not exported by the Git module
Can't continue after import errors at /Applications/SourceTree.app/Contents/Resources/git_local/libexec/git-core/git-svn line 49.
BEGIN failed--compilation aborted at /Applications/SourceTree.app/Contents/Resources/git_local/libexec/git-core/git-svn line 49.
Completed with errors, see above
{noformat}
 

 

Workaround: Instead of using the embedded git (2.15.1), if I use the system git (version 2.6.4) it works fine.
fields.summary: git svn rebase fails with error "get_record" is not exported by the Git module

fields.description:
I have two different BitBucket Servers to which I am connecting. The first one is BitBucket Server version 4.7.1 which I connect to via HTTPS protocol (actually the url is just [http://foo.bar:7990|http://foo.bar:7990/]). The second one is BitBucket Server version 5.7.1 which I connect to via HTTPS protocol (and the url for this one is actually [https://baz.bar:8443). |https://baz.bar:8443).%C2%A0/]

I have tried using the Beta version 2.7.1 (155) and the issue still persisted. I have deleted all passwords from KeyChain Access with no success. I also tried completely uninstalling the application and deleting both ~/Library/Application Support/SourceTree and ~/Library/Preferences/com.torusknot.SourceTree* and then reinstalling again with no success. 

I also tried reverting to 2.6.3 (134) and that seems to partially solved the issue. I now no longer get the error when working with server version 4.7.1 and I can see the password for that in KeyChain Access. However with server version 5.7.1 I don't see the password in KeyChain Access and every time I interact with that server I have to enter the password twice before this succeeds. 

What is the best way to report this issue to Atlassian? I am not sure if it is helpful or not to post the a question that has been marked as solved which it seems like many users are still having issues with.

Note that "foo" and "baz" aren't the same servers but my username and credentials are the same on "foo" and "baz".

 

This is from a discussion at: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Sourcetree-questions/Why-do-I-get-this-error-when-entering-my-correct-password-when/qaq-p/706468]
fields.summary: Getting an error when entering my correct password when prompted to do so when pushing

fields.description:
Hi Team,

Steven Wu has an issue when he opens his SourceTree application, it unexpectedly crashes. After it crashes, he gets the possibility to "Reopen" or "Don't Reopen" the application, but it has the same outcome (the application crashes).

Could you advise what's causing the issue?

Thank you,

Norbert Csupka

Bitbucket Cloud
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes at startup

fields.description:
Pushing to https://github.com/....

2018-02-17 23:02:09.613 git-credential-sourcetree[37434:8727866] Error generating password due to missing uuid. Please report this to Atlassian.

 

Because of this error, I can not PUSH changes to the repo. There appears to be no way to resolve it, restart, re-login, nothing works.
fields.summary: Error generating password due to missing UUID

fields.description: If the branch name contains special characters like "schöner branch", it will not be displayed in bold even if one switches to that according branch. However, if the branch name is "schoener branch" it will be displayed in bold once it's activated.
fields.summary: Active branch not highlighted if it contains special characters

fields.description:
*Issue*

File search does not find the files without a full path.

*Improvement*

The first improvement would be to add auto completion like Tower Git App does. The second improvement is to use the embedded git search for file search. Support wildcards. I.e. git log --all -- '**/my_icon.png' found my png files in the terminal but not in the SourceTreee Search.

fields.description:
I've three different accounts activated in SourceTree. Two different Bitbucket accounts and one GitHub account.

If I switch to the Remote tab in the SourceTree overview, I'll get all repos of my private Bitbucket account and of the GitHub account. I don't see the repos of the Bitbucket account of my company. I'm not an administrator, but I've rights to read and write. In the browser I've access to all the repos.
fields.summary: Remote tab doesn't list my repos (only of one account)

fields.description: macOS 10.12.6
fields.summary: Default open repo view changed with 2.7
Subrepositories are not listed

fields.description: dragging the right hand side of the pane too close to the edge causes the pane size to collapse to zero width. gif attached
fields.summary: Dragging to adjust size of File status pane causes UI glitch

fields.description:
The normal git-flow process when finishing a release is:
 # Merge release branch into master
 # Tag master with the release version
 # Merge release branch into develop
 # Delete release branch

When used through Sourcetree, git-flow is only completing steps 1 & 2. No error dialogs.

---

To reproduce: make a test project initialized with git-flow, add a couple of commits on develop, start a new release, make a commit in the release branch and try and finish the release. I end up sat on master, release branch still there and develop missing the commit from the release branch.

I installed git-flow using Homebrew and tried the same test from the command line with git-flow. It works fine.

So I switched Sourcetree to system git-flow and tried again. I do get an error dialog now, with this message:

flags:WARN getopt: illegal option -- f

 -- /var/folders/h8/n_m5b8zs26bdcng40f1p2xp80000gn/T/SourceTreeTemp.1BO8Ra 1.3

flags:FATAL unable to parse provided options with getopt.
fields.summary: Finishing a release with git flow partially completes but fails silently

fields.description:
After supplying info for accounts for 2 different Bitbucket servers, the accounts are indistinguishable within the Preferences display. You can't drill down into those accounts to see which is which. Editing the entries only lets you see/change your username and password, not server info.

Please let us:
 A) See more info
 B) Provide a nickname for the accounts so we can tell the difference!

Screenshot attached.
fields.summary: All servers of the same type look identical in Accounts preferences

fields.description:
SourceTree user interface is constantly out of date and does not recognise changes made on the filing system - this affects source files edited via the editor as well as any changes made via git command line.

The net effect is that it is ridiculously easy to make a commit (and subsequent pull request) whcih is incomplete because SourceTree has not noticed that there are additional files to be added to the index.

Sometimes, you can persuade SourceTree to update by switching between views, but sometimes the only way is to close it and restart.

These problems usually occur even if the only tools which use git in that repo is SourceTree and the only other changes are text changes by my IDE.

Sometimes, even if I use SourceTree to commit and change branches, the Repository Browser will show the wrong branch - i.e. SourceTree does not recognise changes that SourceTree made moments before.

I have reported this on the forum back in November 2017 - so three months ago, and despite several updates the problem persists.  Forum post with screen shots here: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Sourcetree-questions/SourceTree-UI-is-constantly-out-of-date/qaq-p/669649#M18206]

I've marked this as Major severity because it makes SourceTree unusuable and drives users to switch to other products.
fields.summary: SourceTree User Interface is constantly out of date

fields.description:
Currently when cloning big repositories there is no indication of the progress. The GUI only shows an alwasy full progress bar and an output like:

{code}Cloning into '/Users/user/reponame'...{code}

Whereas using _git clone_ in the console prints something like:
{code}Cloning into 'reponame'...
remote: Counting objects: 3210526, done.
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (986046/986046), done.
Receiving objects:  85% (2757840/3210526), 507.21 MiB | 984.00 KiB/s{code}

Since the cloning can take a long time, the SourceTree looks like it froze. It would be nice to get some progress indicator, even if it is not updated constatly but e.g. once every 5 seconds.
fields.summary: Add status indicator when cloning repositories

fields.description: It will be very helpful if there is a terminal window integrated in the SourceTree app so we can use the terminal from within the app rather then keep switching between SourceTree app and the terminal. So something like how other IDEs have, e.g. PhpStorm and NetBeans.
fields.summary: Integrate a Terminal window in SourceTree App

fields.description:
Source Tree makes *many* ssh attempts, and is causing my computer to be dropped from my University network due to the perceived DOS attack. Our network has DOS protection set to block computers that make 30 SSH attempts in a rolling 2 minute window. SourceTree was triggering this every few days until I identified the issue. 

Connecting via https is a good workaround, but it took a long time to identify the issue and caused major issues on my development computer for several weeks.
fields.summary: Too many SSH Attempts

fields.description:
This forum relates : [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-questions/Authenticating-with-Bitbucket-not-possible/qaq-p/502460] 

I recently purchased a new MacBook pro, with High Sierra. 

I Installed the latest version 2.7 of Sourcetree, but try as I might, I could not get oAuth or SSh to work with my machine. I had to change my account names for both Bitbucket and Github, which were the same username. This worked in the end, but I cannot auth my accounts from within Sourcetree, I have to manually visit the websites for each service, copy the HTTPS link and clone manually. Not ideal, I would have liked to do it all from within Sourcetree. 

Please can this be raised as an issue? There are several other folks complaining about the same issue.
fields.summary: Authenticating with Bitbucket not possible

fields.description:
Add optional "Author" and "Date" columns to the file status pane when in Flat list and Tree modes. See attached screenshot for example.

This feature will allow users to easily so who made the last commit to a specific file or folder.
fields.summary: Add "Author" and "Date" columns to File Status

fields.description:
Using the Stash button, SourceTree appears to stash the changes but none are listed in the sidebar and the "Show" button is missing.  Issuing "git stash list" on the command line returns no stashes.

There appears to be some bug because the list of stashes shows briefly and then all of them are gone.   See attached video.

Adams-MBP:recall_eventify awinn$ git stash pop
No stash entries found.

fields.summary: Error generating password due to missing uuid. Please report this to Atlassian.

fields.description:
SourceTree is great - it's the best GUI git client I've used.

But the repo browser could be better.  One of the problems I have is that I have lots of repos I save from github - I save interesting projects as I find them.  Later, I want to organize them but I It's hard with only a vertical drag/scroll.  It would be nice if there was some kind of tree view with repository groups on the left and repos on the right. If I want to move something from one group to another - I can drag to the group on the left.

Another common pain point would be able to see the files or at least the readme from the repo browser.  I have repo called "natural" - what is that?  NLP, Natural fit algo, etc.  Now I have to open the repo and see - which is friction.

Another similar point point is that I would like to add a description and tags to repos.  Eg.  I might have 5 repos that are doing similar things and I want to keep them because each does something I like more - I would like to be able to write a comment to help me remember that.  It would also be nice to have tags to group products in the way I want.  Eg, all the projects that use a certain library (reactjs, scikit) or language (python, php, etc.)

 

I think these points could be solved without much difficulty and would make the client much more useful.
fields.summary: Repo browser needs some UX love

fields.description:
As pair programming is more and more common, it would be useful to be able to include co-authors in commit messages. The git community ([openstack|https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages#Including_external_references] in this case) has agreed on using a trailer _Co-Authored-By_ for that, but it is quite cumbersome to add that on every commit.

 

The Github Desktop tool [added a feature|https://desktop.github.com/features/co-authors/] which let you choose co-authors from existing project collaborators. This is a nice solution for this problem.
fields.summary: Provide a way to include Co-Authored-By in commits

fields.description:
When I'm looking through my branch history, trying to find the one I want, sometimes I click other commits in the commit history to read their information. I then forget which color history line I was looking at and need to scroll back to the last commit of the branch I'm on.

It would be really great if I could simply click the branch name _that is already focused_ in the sidebar to re-focus the history view on the associated branch's last commit, just like when you click a non-focused branch name in the branch list.

This is also a workaround for the bug caused by clicking a branch name in the list soon after the history view thread is still busy. Nothing happens the first time you click the branch name, you must click some other branch name, then click back to the one you tried to view initially.
fields.summary: Clicking branch name refocus history

fields.description: See attached screenshot.  !image-2018-02-07-10-38-26-462.png!

and the repository exists.

fields.description: Since last update I encountered several app crashes, I attach two of crash log files
fields.summary: SourceTree 2.7 crashed several times on Mac 10.13.2

fields.description:
The Date column in the Log : <File> window does not display the date as my macOS preference is set (in particular does not respect DD/MM/YY here).

 

Look at the attached screenshot
fields.summary: Log Selected file columns does not respect user region/date formatting

fields.description:
The numbers of pending commits are not updated in time. They are always outdated. "Refresh remote status" doesn't help in most cases.

And also they are not very intuitive. It's not easy to understand which icon means waiting to pull and which waiting to push.

Would be nice to improve it.

!Monosnap 2018-02-05 17-58-03.png!
fields.summary: Number of pending commits is not updated in time

fields.description:
When you click the little menu next to Unstaged Files, there is an option to "Discard File". This will discard all changes you made to that file and essentially reset it.

My opinion is that this should simply be renamed in the menu to "Discard Changes" instead of "Discard File". It is simply more straightforward and less confusing. Discard File could easily be misunderstood as deleting the file or removing it from the work directory.
fields.summary: "Discard File" change to "Discard Changes"

fields.description:
When you try to clone, pull or push to a repository using SSH with ssh-key authentication, *the connection will fail, if the ssh-key is protected with a passphrase*. As soon as the passphrase is removed from the ssh-key, the connection can be established.

*Requirements:*
- ssh key with passphrase
- git repository
- working ssh connection to git repository server using ssh-key

*Fail:*
- open sourceTreeApp
- new => clone from URL
- enter Source URL: ssh://my-user@my-git-server.com/srv/git/my-git-repository.git
- press return or tab
- => *Password Required* window is shown

The _Password Required_ window is not the expected window to enter the ssh-key passphrase! It's a window to enter the my-user's password for the my-git-server.com, which probably might not work, because the user cannot connect to the server using username/password.

*Goal:*
- open sourceTreeApp
- new => clone from URL
- enter Source URL: ssh://my-user@my-git-server.com/srv/git/my-git-repository.git
- press return or tab
- *SSH-Key Password* window is shown
- enter ssh-key passphrase, check/uncheck checkbox _Store Passphrase In Keychain_, press _OK_
- git repository is detected
- repository can be cloned
fields.summary: SSH connection fails for ssh keys with passphrase

fields.description: !Screen Shot 2018-02-02 at 3.50.15 PM.png!
fields.summary: CPU utilization without workload

fields.description:
It would be nice if there was an option or preference in the branch selector to only show open branches.

Our practice is this: When working on a new issue, we create a private branch for it, do the work, commit, and push to the shared repo.  Then we create a pull request, it gets approved, we merge and close the branch.

This means that if we fix a thousand bugs, we have a thousand branches, mostly closed.  They ALL get displayed in the branch selector, which can be annoying if one is searching for a certain branch.

Also it would be nice if 'master' was at the top.

Yes, I checked the preferences to make sure it wasn't already there.
fields.summary: Option to only show open branches in Sourcetree branch selector.

fields.description:
Within the "History" view, there exists three drop-down choosers above the history of commits list. The first chooses which branch to view: All, Current, and local branches.

When a local branch is deleted, the list is not immediately updated. That is the minor symptom.

Worse, if a local branch is selected in that pop-up, and that same local branch is deleted, then I get errors from the application.

STEPS to reproduce:
 # History View.
 # Assume local branches A and B exist.
 # Checkout Branch A
 # In the Branch pop-up, choose to view Branch B.
 # Now delete Branch B in the Branches list on the left of the window.

ACTUAL RESULT:

Error dialog pops up after successful deletion:
{panel:title=Error encountered}
'git log' failed with code 128:'fatal: bad revision 'Branch B'
 '
{panel}
 This has been an issue for many versions of the application.

EXPECTED RESULT:

Chooser will automatically remove the stale entry and switch to Current Branch view (or All Branch View).
fields.summary: Branch drop-down doesn't properly refresh after deleting a GIT branch

fields.description:
[Feature Request] SourceTree can add Issue reference when committing.

Eg. when we type # <- it will render the issue for this repo. It will be easy to reference and close the issue.

 

2. If there is an issue section to view all the open / close issue for developer to view or update it will be nice as well.
fields.summary: SourceTree can add Issue reference when committing.

fields.description:
Yesterday I upgraded to version 2.7 (152) of Sourcetree and since then, i have been having problems with pushing to repositories via ssh (username and password) where there were no problems in the earlier version iI had installed:

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false -c credential.helper=sourcetree push -v --tags staging refs/heads/staging:refs/heads/staging

Pushing to ssh://xxxxxx@xxx.xxx.xxx.103:/~/git/staging.git

Permission denied, please try again.

Permission denied, please try again.

Permission denied (publickey,gssapi-keyex,gssapi-with-mic,password).

fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

 

Please make sure you have the correct access rights

and the repository exists.

Completed with errors, see above

 

 

If I do the same operation using a manual command and password insertion:

git push xxxxx  yyyyyyy

It Works.

Can you please provide some help?

 

Regards
fields.summary: Pushing with ssh error

fields.description:
Each time I open the SourceTree or let it sit in the background a dozens of pop-ups open with the same error:

Password required
For user k41n on host bitbucket.org

([https://www.dropbox.com/s/lmzncrvkg7k8z1f/sourcetree_error.png?dl=0)]

It started quite recently, I would say with the upgrade to 2.7.

Funnily enough - I don't have Bitbucket account!

Also - this is VERY annoying as those pop-ups steal focus...
fields.summary: Password required For user k41n on host bitbucket.org

fields.description:
I am experiencing the following error, when attempting to push with SSH. Although, no error occurs when attempting a pull. If I pull via command line, the error does not occur, so seemly, the error is with Sourcetree. I already checked permissions, and that is not the problem, since it works find via command line.

—

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false -c credential.helper=sourcetree push -v --tags origin refs/heads/master:refs/heads/master 

Pushing to ssh://git@x:22/x.git

Permission denied, please try again.

Permission denied, please try again.

Received disconnect from x port 22:2: Too many authentication failures

Disconnected from x port 22

fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

 

Please make sure you have the correct access rights

and the repository exists.

Completed with errors, see above
fields.summary: Push via SSH - Too many authentication failures

After I commit & push only the "File status" screen resets to Light Theme.

Switching to another screen and coming back doesn't resolve the issue.

Workaround - reapply the Dark Theme setting.

fields.description: With previous versions of SourceTree that used a tree structure instead of tabs, it was easy to see what was associated with each bookmark. With the new tab structure, there is no way to know that short of switching to a tab to see the branch. It would be very helpful to get this indication in some way which would improve the usability a lot.

fields.description:
I used the form that provides the login to github account. 

I did everything from there (generated the private/public key) and gave access to source tree to submit the key

Everything was failing, but my terminal could authenticate (I think I had to add the key to ssh-agent, not sure)

to fix:

I deleted the submitted key from github, I edited the .pub file to remove the last sentence: something like : "key auto generated by sourcetree"

then I added that key to github and my 'git clone' worked well
fields.summary: Autogenerated/submitted key fails

fields.description:
Hi, 

the application is idle and eat 50% of the CPU, if I do a commit and the pipeline starts in bitbuteck the app eats 110% of the CPU. My mac is very hot all the time.

Regards
fields.summary: Application eats CPU

fields.description:
When switching branches the overview repo listing doesn't update the branch name badge until either the application quits, or the repo listing is dragged in the overview list.

This is a new behavior to 2.7. I don't recall having this issue with previous versions.

See attached video for demonstration.
fields.summary: Current branch listing in overview not updating
Grouping/Sorting/Filtering staged files in File Status tab

fields.description: Would love to have "Open with <insert code editor name>" option next to "Show in Finder" (in Mac) to open repository folders directly with a code editor, such as Visual Studio Code, Atom, etc.
fields.summary: Request: Open with code editor

fields.description:
Using the new version of 2.7 which is released, contrary to what Jira is showing in the versions drop down, trying to authenticate to a mercurial repository using https with username/password fails with 2.7.   I will prompt repeatedly for the password, never persist it in the keychain, add a keychain token for application password (which obviously is useless it seems), and fail all authentication checks.

Opening the exact same repository with the same credentials in 2.6.3 has no issues whatsoever, creating what seems to be a working application password.

Basically, 2.7 is useless.  This is a far too often recurring theme with Sourctree updates and my team now generally refuses to do an update until it is tested thoroughly, which is a colossal waste of time for all involved.
fields.summary: Authentication cannot be set on Mercurial https repository

fields.description: OpenSSH7.3p1から利用できるようになっているincludeキーワードを対応出来るように、ビルトインされているgit及びOpenSSHのバージョンアップグレードを対応して欲しい。
fields.summary: Support the SSH Config file rule with the keyword "include"

I'm done a deep revision of all strings because I have found many errors in the translation.

Once I have started the job I have found many strings that they don't appear in the latest version of the app and they are not used because these strings are from older version.

To improve the translations it's necessary a maintenance deleting the older strings that they aren't in use.

fields.description:
After upgrading to SourceTree Version 2.7 (152) today I'm seeing high CPU usage when SourceTree is running with one of my repositories open. I see sustained CPU usage from 90-100% (of one core) for around 30 seconds, which then reduces to 30-40%. It seems to spike back up to near 100% when the SourceTree window is in the background without focus (e.g. it's doing that as I write this report while SourceTree is behind my web browser).

High CPU usage continues even after I close the repository window, until I quit and restart SourceTree. I have seen it drop back down to ~1-2% as well but when I first noticed the issue, SourceTree was hovering at high CPU usage even after I hadn't interacted with it for a while.

I am seeing this with multiple private Git repositories from my company's Bitbucket account, but not with every repository. Unfortunately I haven't found an open source repository that I can reproduce this problem with yet. I realize this would be a much better bug report with a repro against a publicly available repository – I don't have time to do more searching for one today but let me know if that is critical and I will try to get a better repro when I can.

I did not see this problem prior to upgrading to 2.7 today.
fields.summary: SourceTree high CPU usage
